overview:
Jenny Tcharnaia is a Co-Founder and Chief Financial Officer of triMirror. She is responsible for the general strategy of the company, outlining and implementing new company projects, business development and partnerships, capital fundraising, investor relations, and financial planning. She is passionate about building a successful venture from start-up to exit.

Prior to co-founding triMirror, Jenny held the position of Mergers and Acquisitions Analyst at Ernst & Young Orenda Corporate Finance, where she provided transaction advisory services relating to mergers and acquisitions, valuations, divestitures, and financing engagements in various industries. In this role, Jenny received the 2009 Ernst & Young TAS GTA Recognition Award for exceptional client service.

In university, she completed internships at RBC Dominion Securities (summer 2007) and Ernst & Young Orenda (summer 2008.) Between 2006 and 2009, Jenny acted as business consultant and media editor for Quakeup Media Productions, Inc. which she co-founded. Her role included consulting e-commerce businesses on strategy and modern marketing techniques. Jenny also assisted in the successful sale and exit of a prior social networking business associated with Quakeup.

Jenny holds a bachelor of international business administration with distinction from the Schulich School of Business at York University with a specialization in Finance, and completed an exchange at Universit√© Paris-Dauphine as part of her program. She is currently working toward her CFA designation.

degrees.subject: International BBA, Finance Specialization, exchange in Paris, Certificate of Advanced French Language Proficiency
degrees.institution: York University - Schulich School of Business
